control.name: errorloadingmodtranslation
control.text: Error loading mod translation (English translation is required), check folder:

control.name: norulmod
control.text: No webpage listed for this mod

control.name: restorekb
control.text: Are you sure you want to restore the default controls?

control.name: restorenp
control.text: Are you sure you want to restore controls without a numeric keypad?

control.name: presetchange
control.text: Are you sure you want to load this preset? It will replace all your current settings (only gameplay and audio setting are kept).

control.name: makeDebugPack
control.text: Make a debug pack (you must provide it if doing a bug report)

control.name: packStory
control.text:
The FF7 SYW project is a pack including Final Fantasy VII with graphical reprocessing thanks to advanced artificial intelligence on background images, fights, world map, mini games and video sequences, other elements have also been recreated while preserving the original essence of the game.
In addition, the pack contains various advanced configuration options and various patches such as save-anywhere functions, autorun, disable random battles, fast forward, challenges and difficulty mods of all kinds... all this to offer an unprecedented gaming experience and comfort.

control.name: graphicsFields
control.help:
HD SYW fields:
Textures of the game fields reprocessed in HD.
The database is processed with an ESRGan AI.
Lots of optimizations by hand.
This greatly improves the textures of the original game.
It is recommended to activate this option.
control.author: Satsuki_Yatoshi and Aavock

control.name: graphicsAnimations
control.help:
Advanced animations:
Allow to restore the original animations of the scenes of the game with HD textures.
For example the waterfall at Aerith's house and a lot of light effects.
It takes a lot of power, if you notice slowdowns in game, it is recommended to disable this option.
control.author: Satsuki_Yatoshi and Aavock

control.name: graphicsLb
control.help:
Limit Break fields:
Textures of the game fields reprocessed in HD by Cosmos.
It's mandatory for real 16/9 option but can be used in original 4:3 too.
Lots of optimizations by hand.
This greatly improves the textures of the original game.
Compared to original SYW HD textures, it tend to be recover more details but is less smooth, and is less consistant from one field to another.
Which is looking the best is realy up to you, try both and use the one you want.
control.author: Cosmos

control.name: graphicsBattles
control.help:
HD fight scenes:
Textures of the battle scenes reprocessed in HD.
The base is processed with an ESRGan AI plus hand optimizations.
This greatly improves the textures of the original game.
Geometry and lighting bugs from the original game have been fixed by AxlRose.
It is recommended to activate this option.
control.author: Satsuki_Yatoshi and AxlRose

control.name: axl3dbattle
control.help:
AxlRose's Blender:
3D battle scenes corrections.
Fixes the "shadow/light" effect (blending) of the ground/floor for all affected Battle Stages.
Improvements to the Battle Fields were done directly to the 3D model's floor meshes.
It is recommended to activate this option.
control.author: AxlRose

control.name: graphicsMagics
control.help:
HD battle magics:
Textures of the magic and combat effects done from scratch in HD.
The vast majority of textures are done from scratch but some elements have been reprocessed in HD with an ESRGan AI.
This modernizes the original game without distorting it.
It is recommended to activate this option.
control.author: Kela51 and Satsuki_Yatoshi

control.name: graphicsWorldMap
control.help:
HD world maps:
Textures of the world maps reprocessed in HD.
The base is processed with an ESRGan AI plus hand optimizations.
This greatly improves the textures of the original game.
It is recommended to activate this option.
control.author: Satsuki_Yatoshi

control.name: graphicsCosmosGaia
control.help:
Cosmos Gaia:
Worldmap overhaul that re-implements the terrain rendering to add analog movement and camera controls, real-time lighting and extended view distance.
Use [CAMERA] and [TARGET] to change the viewing distance.
You must use analog controller option or it won't work (driver section).
It is recommended to activate this option as long as you use an analog controller.
control.author: Cosmos

control.name: graphicsMiniGames
control.author: Aavock, Satsuki_Yatoshi and jtd
control.help:
HD mini games:
Textures of the mini games done from scratch in HD.
The vast majority of textures are done from scratch but some elements have been reprocessed in HD with an ESRGan AI.
This modernizes the original game without distorting it.
It is recommended to activate this option.

control.name: FFNxGamutNtsc
control.author: ChthonVII
control.help:
NTSC-J color gamut:
Simulates the color gamut of the 1990s Japanese televisions for which FF7 was originally developed.
This gives you the opportunity to recover the true colors of the game, which were poorly converted in the PC version. The colors are warmer and more vivid.
Usable with original and HD textures.
If you are using third party mods which are not HD conversions of the original game but textures made from scratch, this option may distort the colors.

control.name: FFNxLighting
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
3D shadows:
This option adds shadows to 3D models in the game.
This gives a real presence to the 3D models, whether original ones or third-party models.
You need a decent PC not to suffer from a slowdown in the game with this option.
On rare occasions, shading bugs might arise, but the gaming immersion that this option offers outweighs any inconvenience.

control.name: soundsListHelp
control.text:
Click on a speaker to load the mod's audio tracks.
Then click on a track in the list to listen to it.
It may take a few moments for playback to begin.

control.name: FFNxGroup3dEngine
control.help:
Choose the rendering engine:
The optimal type of rendering engine depends on the graphics card of the pc and the options of the game.
It is strongly recommended to keep Automatic selected.
Crashes may occur when using OpenGL with ATI/AMD graphics cards.
Some ATI/AMD graphics cards run more stable on D3D12.

control.name: FFNxGroupScreen
control.author: FFNx team
control.help: Choose the display type.

control.name: FFNxGroupResolution
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the screen resolution:
Automatic uses the game resolution in windowed mode or the current desktop resolution in fullscreen mode.
The selection is particularly useful when playing in windowed mode.

control.name: FFNxGroupRatio
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the aspect ratio:
• 4:3 like the original game maintains the aspect ratio in 4:3 and fills the left and right sides with black bars.
• Stretched 16:9 fills the image according to the size. There are no known bugs for this aspect ratio but the image is vertically crushed.
• True 16:9 modifies the game engine to output a real 16:9 wherever possible. Some bugs may appear (non-blocking).
• True 16:10 modifies the game engine to output a real 16:10 wherever possible. This is the ideal aspect ratio for the Steam Deck (experimental feature).
• Uncropped 4:3 modifies the game engine to output a real 4:3 without top and bottom black bars (experimental feature).
• Uncropped Stretched 16:9, same as Stretched 16:9 but without top and bottom black bars (experimental feature).

control.name: FFNxGroupIR
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the internal resolution:
Uses game supersampling to multiply the internal resolution of 640x480 by a selected value, making the image much sharper.
On a PC with decent power, x4 is a good setting.
If you see stray lines on certain elements of the game (rare but can happen with certain configurations), try a setting of x4 or x2.
Higher values ​​require a more powerful graphics card but can remove scaling artifacts.

control.name: FFNxVsync
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
V-Sync:
Synchronizes the game frame rate with the monitor refresh rate and allows you to avoid in-game image tearing.
May negatively impact performance.
Limits the possible speed adjustment of the speed hack to the refresh rate of the screen (e.g. the base game is 30 fps, if your screen is 60 Hz, the speed hack can speed up the game by a maximum of 2 times).

control.name: FFNxGroupAA
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the anti aliasing:
The edge smoothing of the 3D models is made possible by anti-aliasing.
If you use an internal resolution of x4, this option is not useful.
It is recommended not to exceed the value x4 on Anti-aliasing also.

control.name: FFNxAnisotropic
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Anisotropic filtering:
Anisotropic filtering enables better rendering of very distant 3D textures.
The difference in appearance in the game is more or less obvious depending on the mods used.
May impact performance due to increased memory usage.
It is still recommended that you enable this option by default.

control.name: FFNxGroupHDR
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the HDR nits:
Allows you to specify the maximum HDR value of your screen in case automatic rendering is not optimal.
This setting will be ignored if your display does not support HDR (or if it has not been enabled in the operating system).

control.name: FFNxGroupAudioChannels
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the audio channels:
You can choose the number of audio channels for the game.
Just because you choose multichannel does not mean they will all be used, it depends on the audio mods and their configurations.
If you are unsure, leave Automatic as the selection.

control.name: FFNxGroupAudioSample
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the audio sampling:
It is recommended to keep Automatic as the selection unless you know what you are doing.

control.name: FFNXMusicResume
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Resume music:
Allow you to have continuity in the music of the game.
For example, this means the music doesn't start over again after every battle.

control.name: FFNxAnalogController
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Analog controller:
Enables support for fully omnidirectional analog control for a gamepad with an analog stick.
This option allows you to use the analog stick in menus and for movement (in addition to the directional pad).
It also adds free camera movement in battle using the left analog stick and fully analog 360-degree movement on the fields using the right analog stick.

control.name: FFNxAnalogControllerArun
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Analog run:
If you play with a gamepad with an analog stick, this option allows you to run or walk depending on the inclination of the stick.

control.name: FFNXSteamSucces
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Steam achievements:
Enables Steam achievements.
Requires Steam to already be started or it won't work.

control.name: FFNxGroupControllerDeathzones
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the gamepad dead zones (stick, LT, RT):
Allows you to set the dead zones of the analog controls of the gamepad.
Requires "Analog Controller" to be enabled as an option.

control.name: FFNxGroupSpeedhack
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the speedhack (step, minimum, maximum):
You can use a speed hack (fast forward) in the game (see general help).
When using V-Sync, the possible speed adjustment of the speed hack is limited to the refresh rate of the screen (e.g. the base game is 30 fps, if your screen is 60 Hz, the speed hack can speed up the game by a maximum of 2 times).
The maximum speed is also limited by the performance of the PC.

control.name: FFNxGroupFps
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Choose the fluidity of the game (fps):
Originally, FF7's fluidity is limited. The menus are in 60 fps, but the game scenes are in 30 fps and the battles scenes are in 15 fps.
Thanks to this option, you can choose whether you want the battles to run more smoothly at 30 frames per second or whether you want the entire game to run at 60 frames per second.
The option to display battles in 30 frames per second requires interpolated battle models.
The option to display the full game in 60 frames per second also requires interpolated models (those of the game scenes) as well as some game patches to avoid (minor) errors in certain scenes.
The battle models included in the package are already interpolated.
The game patches included in the package are available for German, French and English.

control.name: FFNxShowStats
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
View FFNx information:
Shows you various information (on the left in full screen mode or in the title bar of the window).
This includes fps, driver version, memory usage,...

control.name: FFNxDebugTool
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Debug tool:
Activates the debug tool in an overlay window.
This window can be displayed or hidden using the F12 key on the keyboard.
Among other things, real-time information about the rendering process and performance is displayed, as well as other information, a teleportation tool and the management of the shadows of 3D models.

control.name: FFNxLogs
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Complete logs:
To be used only in the event of a major bug and only when requested to do so by the package author or someone from the FFNx team.
This consumes a lot of resources but allows to log all the information of the game driver.

control.name: FFNxFootSteps
control.author: FFNx team
control.help:
Enable footsteps:
This option activates footsteps on the various screens of the game.
These noises can be adapted to the type of ground if you use an audio mod that allows it.

control.name: FFNxNoCd
control.author: Satsuki_Yatoshi
control.help:
No-CD:
Applies a no-cd patch to the game executable before launching.
This eliminates the need to insert FF7 game discs to play.

control.name: FFNxGroupAlphaDiag
control.author: FFNx's Team
control.help:
Choose the transparency of all windows (dialogs / battles):
Allows you to choose a level of transparency for the background of the dialogue and combat windows.

control.name: FFNxAlphaDiag
control.author: FFNx's Team
control.help: Enable transparency on dialogs's windows.

control.name: FFNxAlphaBattle
control.author: FFNx's Team
control.help: Enable transparency on battles's windows.

control.name: FFNxalphaValue
control.author: FFNx's Team
control.help: Choose windows's transparency level.

control.name: analogPadUse
control.text: In order to be able to use the analog stick (L3) for movement, it is mandatory to activate “Analog controller” in the driver configuration.

control.name: chooseHelp
control.text: Choose a help file from the drop-down list.

control.name: errorFile
control.text: An error occurred while loading the following file:

control.name: unknownExe
control.text: This executable of FF7 is not recognized. Impossible to use a No-CD patch.

control.name: quit
control.text:
Loading may take time depending on the options chosen and the power of the computer.
Are you sure you want to quit?
